chapters.title: The Last Swim
chapters.description: Kaito swims alone in the pool early in the morning. With memories of his mother and his Olympic dream in his heart, he embarks on his final swim.

sentences.早朝の冷たい空気が肺を満たす。: The cold morning air fills my lungs.
sentences.沖縄の小さな町のオリンピックプールに、僕以外誰もいない。: No one else is here in the Olympic pool of a small Okinawan town, except for me.
sentences.水面に朝焼けの薄い光が反射して、揺らめいている。: The faint light of the sunrise reflects and shimmers on the water's surface.
sentences.プールの底に描かれた青いラインは、まるで僕の人生の道筋のようだ。: The blue line painted on the bottom of the pool is like the path of my life.
sentences.僕は高台から水の中へ飛び込んだ。: I dove into the water from the high platform.
sentences.水が肌を包み込み、一瞬の冷たさの後に温かさを感じる。: The water envelops my skin, and after an initial chill, I feel a warmth.
sentences.この感覚は、もう何千回も経験してきた。: I have experienced this sensation thousands of times.
sentences.繰り返される動作は、瞑想のようだった。: The repetitive movements were like a meditation.
sentences.指先まで意識してごらん。: Try to feel it all the way to your fingertips.
sentences.水は君の友達よ」 母の声が、水の音に混じって聞こえる気がする。: The water is your friend.' My mother's voice blends with the sound of the water, and I feel as if I can hear it.
sentences.僕の母であり、最高のコーチだった人。: My mother, and the best coach I ever had.
sentences.僕にオリンピックの夢を託した人。: The one who entrusted me with her Olympic dream.
sentences.「海翔、このプールは世界と繋がっているの。: 'Kaito, this pool is connected to the world.
sentences.いつか君がその世界で一番になるのを見るのが、ママの夢よ」 あの頃、僕の体はまだ小: It's Mama's dream to see you become the best in that world someday.' Back then, my body was still small, but my mother's words were deeply etched into my heart.
sentences.僕の泳ぎは、母の夢そのものだった。: My swimming was the embodiment of my mother's dream.
sentences.毎週、毎日、午前５時にはここに来る。: Every week, every day, I come here at 5:00 AM.
sentences.休んだことはほとんどない。: I have rarely missed a day.
sentences.腕が軋み、足が重くなっても、決して止まらない。: Even when my arms ache and my legs feel heavy, I never stop.
sentences.体が求めるのは、この水の感触と、繰り返される呼吸の音だけだった。: All my body sought was this sensation of the water and the sound of my repetitive breathing.
sentences.ゴーグル越しの視界は、常に青いラインを捉えている。: My vision through the goggles is always fixed on the blue line.
sentences.母が逝ってから二年。: It has been two years since my mother passed away.
sentences.プールだけが、僕を母に繋ぎ止める唯一の場所だった。: The pool was the only place that kept me connected to my mother.
sentences.彼女の夢が、僕の体の中に生きている。: Her dream lives within my body.
sentences.プールの端まで泳ぎきると、水面に顔を上げる。: Upon reaching the end of the pool, I lift my face to the surface.
sentences.息を整えながら、ふと視線を横にやると、いつものベンチに田中コーチが座っているのが: As I regulate my breathing, I suddenly cast my gaze sideways and saw Coach Tanaka sitting on his usual bench.
sentences.痩せこけた体で、じっと僕の泳ぎを見つめている。: Thin and frail, he intently watched my swimming.
sentences.コーチは多くを語らない人だ。: Coach is a man of few words.
sentences.僕がプールにいる限り、ただそこにいてくれる。: As long as I'm in the pool, he simply stays there.
sentences.僕が母の夢を追い続けていることを、一番理解している人物だろう。: He must be the one who understands best that I continue to chase my mother's dream.
sentences.彼の目には、いつも誇りと、そして微かな心配の色が浮かんでいる。: In his eyes, there is always pride and a hint of worry.
sentences.最近、泳ぎながら時々、漠然とした感覚に襲われることがある。: Lately, while swimming, I sometimes get a vague feeling.
sentences.この水の中で、何か大切なものが終わりを迎えようとしているような、奇妙な予感。: A strange premonition, as if something precious is coming to an end in this water.
sentences.水の抵抗が、以前より重く感じられる瞬間がある。: There are moments when the water's resistance feels heavier than before.
sentences.肺が、昔のように限界まで酸素を取り込めないような、そんな感覚。: A feeling that my lungs can't take in oxygen to their limit like they used to.
sentences.僕は６フィート４インチ、１９３センチの長身だ。: I am tall, 6 feet 4 inches (193 centimeters).
sentences.水の中では、その体が水流を切り裂くナイフのようだったはずなのに。: In the water, my body should have been like a knife cutting through the current.
sentences.力を振り絞り、水しぶきを上げながらゴールを目指す。: Gathering all my strength, raising splashes, I head for the finish line.
sentences.ぴたりと動きを止めた瞬間、プールの静寂が戻ってきた。: The moment I came to a complete stop, the pool's silence returned.
sentences.冷たい水が僕の体を包み込む。: The cold water envelops my body.
sentences.ゆっくりと顔を上げ、空を見上げた。: Slowly, I lifted my face and looked up at the sky.
sentences.夜明けの空は、鮮やかなグラデーションを描いている。: The dawn sky paints a vivid gradient.
sentences.どこまでも続くでしょう？: It stretches on forever, doesn't it?
sentences.夢も同じよ」 母の声が、また聞こえた気がした。: Dreams are the same.' I felt as if I heard my mother's voice again.

chapters.title: A Wish from the Past
chapters.description: Recalling his mother's final moments at the hospital, her Olympic wish for Kaito, and the profound weight of that promise.

sentences.僕の脳裏には、いつもあの日の光景が焼き付いている。: The scene from that day is always burned into my memory.
sentences.病院の白いベッドの傍らで、僕は母の手を握っていた。: By the white hospital bed, I was holding my mother's hand.
sentences.母の手は驚くほど細く、そして、ひどく冷たかった。: My mother's hand was surprisingly thin and terribly cold.
sentences.窓から差し込む午後の陽光が、白いシーツの上に静かに伸びていたけれど、その光さえも: The afternoon sunlight streaming through the window stretched quietly across the white sheets, but even that light could not dispel the oppressive atmosphere of the room.
sentences.母の呼吸は浅く、時折、苦しそうに喉を鳴らすのが聞こえた。: My mother's breathing was shallow, and occasionally, I could hear her groan as if in pain.
sentences.「海翔…」 母の声は、か細く、ほとんど聞こえないほどだった。: "Kaito..." My mother's voice was faint, almost inaudible.
sentences.僕は震える声で答えた。: I replied in a trembling voice.
sentences.」 けれど、その言葉には何の力もなかった。: Yet, those words held no power.
sentences.母は僕の目をまっすぐ見つめた。: My mother gazed directly into my eyes.
sentences.その瞳には、かつての力強い輝きは失われていたけれど、揺るぎない愛情と、何かを伝え: In her eyes, the powerful gleam they once held was gone, yet unwavering love and a desperate urge to convey something resided within them.
sentences.「ねぇ… 海翔…」 母は力を振り絞るように、僕の手をそっと握り返した。: "Kaito..." As if summoning all her strength, my mother gently squeezed my hand back.
sentences.彼女が何を言おうとしているのか、直感的にわかった。: I instinctively understood what she was about to say.
sentences.「約束… してちょうだい… オリンピック… 諦めないで…。お母さんの… 夢… 海: "Promise me... Don't give up on... the Olympics... Your mother's... dream... Kaito's dream..." Every word sank into my heart like lead.
sentences.僕は涙で滲む視界の中で、必死に頷いた。: Through a tear-blurred vision, I nodded desperately.
sentences.」 この誓いがどれほどの重みを持つのか、その時の僕にはまだ理解できていなかった。: At that moment, I hadn't yet grasped the full weight of this vow.
sentences.ただ、母の願いを、その最後の輝きを守りたかった。: I simply wanted to protect my mother's wish, that last glimmer of her.
sentences.その瞬間、母の顔に微かな安堵の表情が浮かび、そして… 彼女の瞳は静かに閉じられた: At that moment, a faint expression of relief appeared on my mother's face, and then... her eyes quietly closed.
sentences.僕の手の中の温もりが、ゆっくりと、消えていくのを感じた。: I felt the warmth in my hand slowly fade away.
sentences.あの日の出来事は、まるで昨日のことのように鮮明に僕の脳裏に焼き付いている。: The events of that day are still vividly burned into my memory, as if it were yesterday.
sentences.母の最期の言葉、僕が交わした約束。: My mother's last words, the promise I made.
sentences.それは僕を縛りつける呪縛であり、同時に、僕を突き動かす唯一の原動力でもあった。: It was a curse that bound me, and at the same time, the only driving force that propelled me forward.
sentences.今、僕の部屋には、母の笑顔のポートレートが飾られている。: Now, in my room, a portrait of my smiling mother hangs.
sentences.写真の中の母は、いつも僕に優しく微笑みかけてくれる。: My mother in the photo always smiles gently at me.
sentences.その笑顔を見るたびに、胸の奥がきりきりと締め付けられるような痛みが走る。: Every time I see that smile, a sharp, constricting pain runs through my chest.
sentences.オリンピックへの道は、どんどん遠ざかっていくように感じていた。: The path to the Olympics felt increasingly distant.
sentences.泳げば泳ぐほど、体は重く、パフォーマンスは低下していく。: The more I swam, the heavier my body felt, and my performance declined.
sentences.この身体で、母の夢を、僕自身の夢を、本当に叶えられるのだろうか？: With this body, can I truly achieve my mother's dream, and my own?
sentences.罪悪感と、どうしようもない無力感が僕を蝕んでいく。: Guilt and an overwhelming sense of helplessness were eating away at me.
sentences.その時、スマートフォンの着信音が静寂を破った。: Just then, my smartphone's ringtone broke the silence.
sentences.ディスプレイには「田中コーチ」の文字。: On the display were the words "Coach Tanaka."
sentences.僕は一つ深呼吸をして、通話ボタンを押した。: I took a deep breath and pressed the call button.
sentences.」田中コーチの、いつもの少しぶっきらぼうだが温かい声が響いた。: Coach Tanaka's usual, slightly blunt but warm voice resonated.
sentences.今日も練習に来なかったが。: You didn't come to practice again today.
sentences.」 「あ、はい… 少しだるくて… 今日も休んでしまいました。: "Ah, yes... I felt a bit sluggish... so I took the day off again today."
sentences.水に入るのが、少し… 怖くなっていた。: Getting into the water had become a little... scary.
sentences.」コーチの声には、僕の嘘を見透かしているような響きがあったが、深くは追及しなかっ: There was a hint in the coach's voice that he saw through my lie, but he didn't press further.
sentences.何かあったら、いつでも相談しろ。: If something's wrong, talk to me anytime.
sentences.」 電話を切った後も、僕はしばらく受話器を握りしめていた。: Even after hanging up, I held the receiver tightly for a while.
sentences.田中コーチの言葉は、まるで僕の重荷を少しだけ軽くしてくれたようにも感じた。: Coach Tanaka's words felt as if they had lightened my burden just a little.
sentences.しかし、その重荷の大部分は、やはり母との約束だった。: However, the majority of that burden was still the promise I made to my mother.
sentences.僕は再び、母の写真に視線を戻した。: I looked back at my mother's photo again.
sentences.写真の中の母は、変わらず微笑んでいる。: My mother in the photo was still smiling.
sentences.遠くに見えるプールの屋根が、鈍い光を反射していた。: The distant pool roof was reflecting a dull light.
sentences.あの水の中に、僕の未来はあるのだろうか。: Will my future be found in those waters?
sentences.それとも、母の記憶だけが、そこに残り続けるのだろうか。: Or will only my mother's memory continue to endure there?

chapters.title: Typhoon Warning
chapters.description: A typhoon approaches the town. Kaito resolves to take one final swim before the storm and heads for the pool.

sentences.朝から、町はざわついていた。: The town had been abuzz since morning.
sentences.役場から繰り返し流れる放送が、その理由を告げている。: Repeated broadcasts from the town hall announced the reason.
sentences.「大型で非常に強い台風が、まもなく沖縄本島に接近します。: "A large and extremely powerful typhoon is rapidly approaching Okinawa Main Island.
sentences.通りを歩く人々は皆、足早で、不安げな表情を浮かべていた。: Everyone walking on the streets was hurrying, with anxious expressions on their faces.
sentences.店という店は、慌ただしくシャッターを下ろし、窓にはベニヤ板が打ち付けられていく。: Store after store hurriedly lowered their shutters, and plywood boards were being nailed over the windows.
sentences.漁港では、漁船が陸に引き上げられ、係留ロープが何重にも巻かれていた。: At the fishing port, fishing boats were being pulled ashore, and mooring ropes were wrapped around them multiple times.
sentences.いつもなら活気に満ちているはずのこの町が、まるで息をひそめているかのように感じら: This town, which would usually be bustling with life, felt as if it were holding its breath.
sentences.僕もまた、その不穏な空気の一部だった。: I, too, was a part of that unsettling atmosphere.
sentences.でも、僕の頭の中はただ一つ、プールのことだけだった。: But in my mind, there was only one thing: the pool.
sentences.この暴風雨が来る前に、どうしても一度、泳いでおきたかった。: Before this storm arrived, I absolutely wanted to swim one last time.
sentences.どれだけ体が重くても、どれだけ水が怖くても、最後の練習になるかもしれない、という: That's because I had a premonition that it might be my last practice, no matter how heavy my body felt or how afraid of the water I was.
sentences.プールに到着すると、田中コーチが、すでにプールの窓に目張りをする準備をしていた。: When I arrived at the pool, Coach Tanaka was already preparing to seal off the pool windows.
sentences.彼の顔には、いつもの厳しさと、それ以上の心配が混じり合っていた。: His face showed a mix of his usual strictness and even greater concern.
sentences.無茶はするなよ」 コーチは太い眉をひそめて言った。: Don't do anything reckless," the coach said, his thick eyebrows furrowed.
sentences.僕は軽く会釈するだけで、すぐに更衣室へ向かった。: I simply gave a slight nod and immediately headed for the changing room.
sentences.もう何も言わないが、その視線は僕の背中に刺さっていた。: He said nothing more, but his gaze pierced my back.
sentences.プールサイドに出ると、空気がひんやりと感じられた。: When I stepped onto the poolside, the air felt chilly.
sentences.空は鉛色に染まり、遠くで低い雷鳴が響く。: The sky was stained a leaden grey, and a low rumble of thunder echoed in the distance.
sentences.風が吹き荒れ、プールの屋根がギシギシと音を立てた。: The wind howled, and the pool roof groaned.
sentences.しかし、僕の目の前にある水面は、信じられないほど静かだった。: However, the water surface before me was unbelievably still.
sentences.深い青色を湛え、プールの天井から差し込む薄暗い光を反射している。: It held a deep blue hue, reflecting the dim light filtering in from the pool ceiling.
sentences.まるで、外の嵐とは無関係な、別世界のようだった。: It was as if it were a different world, unrelated to the storm outside.
sentences.これが、僕が知るこのプールの、最後の穏やかな姿になるかもしれない。: This might be the last peaceful image of this pool that I would ever know.
sentences.冷たい水に身を沈める。: I lowered myself into the cold water.
sentences.体が震えたが、それは水の冷たさだけではなかった。: My body trembled, but it wasn't just from the coldness of the water.
sentences.恐怖と、この場所との別れへの寂しさが入り混じった感情だ。: It was a mix of fear and sadness at parting with this place.
sentences.いつもなら軽いはずの腕が、まるで鉛のように重い。: My arms, which should have been light as usual, felt as heavy as lead.
sentences.息継ぎをするたびに、窓の外の空がさらに暗くなっているのが見えた。: With each breath, I could see the sky outside the window growing even darker.
sentences.風の唸り声が大きくなり、プールサイドに設置されたものがカタカタと音を立てる。: The howling of the wind grew louder, and objects placed by the poolside rattled.
sentences.それでも僕は、無心に水を掻いた。: Yet, I instinctively cut through the water.
sentences.一本、また一本と、壁を蹴る。: I pushed off the wall, lap after lap.
sentences.筋肉は硬直し、肺は酸素を求める。: My muscles stiffened, and my lungs craved oxygen.
sentences.僕の泳ぎが、かつてのように輝くことはもうないのかもしれない。: My swimming might never again shine as it once did.
sentences.オリンピックの夢も、もしかしたらもう手の届かない場所にあるのかもしれない。: My Olympic dream might also be out of reach now.
sentences.だが、まだ僕の中には、水と一体になる衝動が残っていた。: But still, an urge to become one with the water remained within me.
sentences.この水の中でだけは、母との約束を、まだ守り続けられている気がした。: Only in this water did I feel I could still keep my promise to my mother.
sentences.残りの力を振り絞り、最後の数メートルを泳ぎ切る。: Mustering my remaining strength, I swam the last few meters to the end.
sentences.壁に手が触れた瞬間、プール全体の空気が、さらに重くなったのを感じた。: The moment my hand touched the wall, I felt the air throughout the entire pool grow even heavier.
sentences.そして、微かに頬に当たる冷たい感触があった。: And then, there was a faint cold sensation on my cheek.
sentences.大粒の雨が、プールの屋根に叩きつけられ始めたのだ。: Large drops of rain had begun to lash against the pool roof.
sentences.ゆっくりと立ち上がり、プールサイドに腰掛けた。: I slowly stood up and sat down on the poolside.
sentences.水滴がしたたり落ちる指先で、水面をそっと撫でる。: With my fingertips, from which water was dripping, I gently caressed the water's surface.
sentences.水面に波紋が広がり、不穏な空を映し出す。: Ripples spread across the water's surface, reflecting the unsettling sky.
sentences.振り返ると、誰もいないプールが、静かに横たわっていた。: Turning around, I saw the empty pool lying silently before me.
sentences.この特別な場所が、嵐に飲み込まれていく。: This special place was about to be swallowed by the storm.
sentences.僕は名残惜しむようにプールの全てを脳裏に焼き付け、重い足取りで更衣室へと向かった: I burned the entire pool into my memory with a sense of reluctance, and with heavy steps, headed for the changing room.
sentences.外は、もう嵐の気配に満ちていた。: Outside, the air was already filled with the presence of the storm.

chapters.title: After the Storm
chapters.description: The morning after the typhoon, Kaito despairs upon seeing the destroyed pool, the moment his Olympic dream crumbles.

sentences.台風一過の朝は、ひどく静まり返っていた。: The morning after the typhoon was eerily still.
sentences.昨日までの狂騒が嘘のように、空気は重く、湿気を帯びていた。: The air was heavy and humid, as if the frenzy of the previous day had been a lie.
sentences.僕は重い足を引きずりながら、いつも練習に向かっていた道のりを歩いていた。: I dragged my heavy feet along the path I always took to practice.
sentences.嫌な予感が全身を支配していた。: A sense of dread consumed my entire being.
sentences.昨夜の暴風が、僕の大切な場所をどう変えてしまったのか、知りたくない、でも見なけれ: I was tormented by the internal conflict of not wanting to know how last night's storm had altered my precious place, yet knowing I had to see it.
sentences.角を曲がり、プールの敷地が視界に入った瞬間、息を呑んだ。: Turning the corner, the moment the pool grounds came into view, I gasped.
sentences.それは僕の知るプールではなかった。: It was no longer the pool I knew.
sentences.まるで巨大な何かに踏み潰されたかのように、すべてが崩壊していた。: Everything lay in ruins, as if it had been crushed by something colossal.
sentences.屋根は吹き飛ばされ、支柱はねじ曲がり、コンクリートの壁にはひびが走り、大きな穴が: The roof had been torn off, support beams were twisted, cracks snaked across the concrete walls, and numerous large holes gaped open.
sentences.練習で何度も飛び込んだ飛び込み台は、無残にも傾いている。: The diving board, from which I had dived countless times during practice, was tragically tilted.
sentences.近づけば近づくほど、その破壊の規模に僕は言葉を失った。: The closer I got, the more speechless I became at the sheer scale of the destruction.
sentences.コースロープはちぎれ、プールサイドには瓦礫や折れた木々が散乱している。: Lane ropes were ripped apart, and the poolside was littered with debris and broken trees.
sentences.濾過装置らしきものは粉々に砕け散り、プールの中には泥水と枝、そして正体不明の残骸: What appeared to be the filtration system lay shattered into pieces, and the pool itself was filled with muddy water, branches, and unidentified wreckage.
sentences.長方形の青い水の代わりに、そこには荒れ果てた、ただの穴があった。: Instead of a rectangular expanse of blue water, there was just a desolate, empty pit.
sentences.僕の訓練の場、僕の夢の舞台が、こうも簡単に消え去ってしまったという事実に、心が凍: My heart froze at the realization that my training ground, the stage of my dreams, had vanished so easily.
sentences.呆然と立ち尽くしていると、背後から足音が聞こえた。: As I stood there dumbfounded, I heard footsteps from behind me.
sentences.」聞き慣れた声に振り返ると、田中コーチが立っていた。: I turned at the familiar voice to see Coach Tanaka standing there.
sentences.彼の顔にも僕と同じ、いやそれ以上の絶望が浮かんでいた。: On his face, too, was despair, similar to mine, or perhaps even deeper.
sentences.コーチは何も言わず、ただ僕の肩にそっと手を置いた。: Coach said nothing, only gently placed a hand on my shoulder.
sentences.その手は温かいのに、僕の心はひどく冷たかった。: His hand was warm, yet my heart felt terribly cold.
sentences.コーチもまた、この光景に打ちひしがれているのが分かった。: I could tell that Coach, too, was utterly devastated by the sight.
sentences.しばらくすると、町の人が何人か集まってき始めた。: After a while, several townspeople started to gather.
sentences.顔見知りの者もいれば、初めて見る者もいた。: Some were familiar faces, while others I was seeing for the first time.
sentences.「なんてことだ」「これはひどいな」といった声が聞こえる。: I heard exclamations like, "Oh my god," and "This is awful."
sentences.被害の大きさにため息をつく者、しかしすぐに「どうやって片付けるか」「再建にはどれ: Some sighed at the sheer extent of the damage, while others quickly shifted to practical discussions about "how to clean this up" and "how long reconstruction will take."
sentences.彼らの声が遠く聞こえる中、僕はただ、崩壊したプールを見つめていた。: As their voices faded into the background, I simply stared at the ruined pool.
sentences.母が亡くなる前、僕にオリンピックの夢を託し、「諦めないで」と約束させた場所。: It was the place where, before she passed away, my mother had entrusted me with her Olympic dream and made me promise never to give up.
sentences.あの誓いを胸に、僕は毎日水に飛び込み、限界まで自分を追い込んできた。: With that vow in my heart, I had dived into the water every day, pushing myself to my absolute limits.
sentences.それが今、この有様だ。: And now, this is what it had come to.
sentences.水への恐怖心、身体の不調、そして今、練習する場所までもが失われた。: My fear of water, my physical ailments, and now, even the place where I trained, were all gone.
sentences.これ以上、どうやって母との約束を守れるというのだろう。: How could I possibly keep my promise to my mother now?
sentences.僕のオリンピックの夢は、この瓦礫の下に完全に埋もれてしまったように思えた。: My Olympic dream felt completely buried beneath this rubble.
sentences.僕は崩れ落ちたプールの中心に立ち、泥水と瓦礫を見下ろした。: I stood in the center of the collapsed pool, looking down at the muddy water and debris.
sentences.灰色の空がどこまでも広がり、僕の未来と同じくらい不透明に見えた。: The grey sky stretched endlessly, looking as opaque as my own future.
sentences.母さん、僕はどうすればいいんだ？: Mom, what am I supposed to do?
sentences.この壊滅的な状況で、どうやって、あの約束を果たせばいいんだ？: In this devastating situation, how am I ever going to fulfill that promise?

chapters.title: Shadows Beneath the Surface
chapters.description: Kaito tries practicing in the sea instead of the pool. However, an encounter with a shark leaves him terrified, and he develops a fear of water.

sentences.プールの無残な姿を目の当たりにして以来、俺の心は鉛のように重かった。: Ever since I witnessed the ruined pool, my heart had felt as heavy as lead.
sentences.オリンピックの夢は、母との約束は、これで終わりなのか？: My Olympic dream, my promise to Mom, is this truly the end?
sentences.絶望が喉元まで迫っていた。: Despair was rising to my throat.
sentences.しかし、諦めることだけはできなかった。: But I just couldn't bring myself to give up.
sentences.プールが駄目なら、他に方法があるはずだ。: If the pool was out, there had to be another way.
sentences.沖縄のこの地で、プールが無理なら、残された唯一の選択肢は――海だ。: Here in Okinawa, if a pool was out of the question, the only option left was—the ocean.
sentences.朝焼けが水平線を赤く染める中、俺は誰もいないビーチに立っていた。: As the dawn glowed red on the horizon, I stood on an empty beach.
sentences.広大な海が目の前に広がる。: The vast ocean stretched out before me.
sentences.練習用のプールとは全く違う、予測不能な生命の息吹を感じた。: It was completely different from a practice pool; I felt the unpredictable breath of life.
sentences.波が砂浜に打ち寄せ、その度、挑戦的な囁きが聞こえる気がした。: Waves crashed onto the shore, and each time, I felt as though I could hear a challenging whisper.
sentences.」 深呼吸をして、冷たい海へ足を踏み入れた。: " I took a deep breath and stepped into the cold ocean.
sentences.最初は震えるような冷たさだったが、すぐに慣れた。: At first, the cold was enough to make me shiver, but I quickly got used to it.
sentences.プールのように整備されたレーンも、ターンを示す壁もない。: There were no well-defined lanes like in a pool, nor walls to indicate turns.
sentences.ただ無限に広がる青い空間。: Just an endlessly sprawling blue space.
sentences.泳ぎ出すと、すぐにプールの水とは全く違う抵抗を感じた。: As I started swimming, I immediately felt a resistance entirely different from pool water.
sentences.波が体を揺らし、定まったリズムを奪っていく。: Waves rocked my body, disrupting my steady rhythm.
sentences.潮流が体を引き、余分な力を使わせる。: Currents pulled at my body, forcing me to expend extra energy.
sentences.そして、塩水が口に入ると、その苦さに思わず顔をしかめた。: And when the saltwater entered my mouth, I couldn't help but grimace at its bitterness.
sentences.それでも、俺は必死に腕をかいた。: Even so, I thrashed my arms desperately.
sentences.これが、今の俺に残された唯一の道だ。: This was the only path left for me now.
sentences.オリンピックの夢を繋ぐための、最後の希望だ。: It was my last hope to keep my Olympic dream alive.
sentences.最初はぎこちなかった泳ぎも、徐々に体が水に馴染んでいくのを感じた。: My initial clumsy strokes gradually gave way as I felt my body adapting to the water.
sentences.波を乗り越え、潮流を読み、ひたすら沖へ向かって進んだ。: I overcame the waves, read the currents, and relentlessly pushed onward towards the open sea.
sentences.ここなら、誰も邪魔しない。: Here, no one would get in my way.
sentences.どれくらい泳いだだろうか。: How long had I been swimming?
sentences.ふと、全身を包み込むような冷たい視線を感じた。: Suddenly, I felt a cold gaze envelop my entire body.
sentences.まるで、水の中に何かが潜んでいるような。: As if something was lurking beneath the water.
sentences.気のせいだ、と自分に言い聞かせ、泳ぎを続けた。: "It's just my imagination," I told myself, and continued swimming.
sentences.背筋が凍るような悪寒が走った。: A spine-chilling premonition ran through me.
sentences.視界の端で、巨大な影が横切った。: At the corner of my eye, a gigantic shadow darted across.
sentences.一瞬、何が起こったのか理解できなかった。: For a moment, I couldn't understand what had happened.
sentences.次の瞬間、俺のすぐ真下から、灰色の一閃が突き上げてきた。: The next instant, from directly below me, a flash of gray shot upwards.
sentences.鋭い歯が並んだ口が、すぐそこにある。: A mouth lined with sharp teeth was right there.
sentences.全身の血が凍りついた。: All the blood in my body froze.
sentences.本能的に、体が勝手に動き出した。: Instinctively, my body moved on its own.
sentences.必死に水をかき、叫び声を上げようとするが、塩水が口に入り、むせて呼吸ができない。: I thrashed desperately at the water, trying to scream, but saltwater filled my mouth, making me choke and unable to breathe.
sentences.心臓が喉まで飛び出してきそうなほど脈打つ。: My heart pounded as if it would leap out of my throat.
sentences.奴は一度通り過ぎたが、また弧を描いてこちらへ向かってくるのが分かった。: It had passed once, but I knew it was circling back towards me.
sentences.とにかく、岸へ。: I had to get to shore, no matter what.
sentences.一秒でも早く、この水から出なければ。: I had to get out of this water, as fast as possible.
sentences.狂ったように腕と足を動かし、後方を見ることもせず、ただひたすら陸を目指した。: I thrashed my arms and legs like a madman, without looking back, simply aiming for the land.
sentences.背後から追ってくる気配はなかったが、恐怖は決して消えなかった。: There was no sign of it pursuing me from behind, but the fear never vanished.
sentences.体が震え、泳ぎが乱れる。: My body trembled, and my strokes became erratic.
sentences.砂浜に足がついた瞬間、俺は力が抜け、その場に崩れ落ちた。: The moment my feet touched the sand, my strength gave out, and I collapsed onto the spot.
sentences.肺が焼け付くように痛み、何度も咳き込んだ。: My lungs burned with pain, and I coughed repeatedly.
sentences.冷たい砂の感触が、現実に戻してくれた。: The feel of the cold sand brought me back to reality.
sentences.きらきらと輝く、どこまでも美しい青。: Sparkling brightly, an infinitely beautiful blue.
sentences.だが、もう、その美しさの中に、俺は潜れない。: But no longer could I immerse myself in that beauty.
sentences.水の中の静かな恐怖が、肌にこびりついている。: The silent terror of the water clung to my skin.
sentences.今まで抱えていた水への違和感や、プールが壊れた絶望なんて比じゃない。: The uneasiness I'd always felt about water, or the despair of the ruined pool, paled in comparison.
sentences.全身が震え、涙が止まらなかった。: My whole body trembled, and tears wouldn't stop flowing.
sentences.オリンピックの夢は、本当に、終わってしまった。: My Olympic dream was truly over.
sentences.俺は、水が、怖かった。: I was afraid of the water.
